$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Experimental Procedure: A mixture of
4-bromotoluene (1 mmol), imidazole (1.2 mmol), K2CO3 (2 mmol) and
Cu(II)-NaY (100 mg) in DMF (3 mL) was heated to 120 °C for the specified
time (Table 2). The progress of the reaction was monitored by GC or TLC.
The reaction mixture was filtered to separate the catalyst and the
filtrate was quenched with aq NaHCO3 and the product extracted with
EtOAc. The combined organic layers were washed with brine, dried over
Na2SO4 and concentrated. The residue was purified by column
chromatography to afford pure 1-(4-methylphenyl)-1H-imidazole. Table 2
Entry 6, yield 99%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM Cu(II)-NaY zeolite catalyst used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):AMD

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for SSA-Catalyzed Silylation
of Nucleobases and Other N-Heterocycles in the Presence of HMDS In a
250-mL round-bottom flask, a mixture of the appropriate nucleobase or
other N-heterocycle (10 mmol), SSA (0.05 g) and HMDS (100 mL) was heated
at reflux until a clear solution was obtained (Table I). Then the
catalyst was filtered off and the filtrate was evaporated under vacuum to
remove the solvent (HMDS). The resulting crude was pure enough as
indicated by GC analysis to be used for any synthetic application and
does not require further purification or characterization. Entry 1 Table
I Silylation of pyrimidine and purine nucleobases and other
N-heterocycles using SSA/HMDS Entry 12 Yield 100%.

$DATUM 2,4,5-triiodo-1H-imidazole According to the described general procedure
(GP10), triiodination (rt; 15h) of imidazole (8.000 g; 117.51 mmol; 1.0
eq.) with iodine (98.424 g; 387.78 mmol; 3.3 eq.) and sodium carbonate
(56.047 g; 528.79 mmol; 4.5 eq.) in a mixture of dioxane (300 ml) and
water (300 ml) afforded 2,4,5-triiodo-1H-imidazole as a yellow solid
(53.620 g; 100%). 2,4,5-triiodo-1H-imidazole, yield 53.620 g; 100%.
LC-MS: tR = 0.84 min.; [M+H]+: 446.66 g/mol.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 2,4,5-triiodo-1 H-imidazole. To a slightly yellow homogeneous solution of
imidazole (5.000 g; 73.444 mmol) in dioxane (135 ml) and distilled water
(135 ml) was added successively, at rt (in one portion), sodium carbonate
(35.029 g; 330.500 mmol), and iodine (61.515 g; 242.366 mmol). The
resulting brown heterogeneous reaction mixture was further stirred at rt,
under nitrogen, for 24h. EA (250 ml) was then added followed by an aq.
solution of sodium thiosulfate (22.50 g Na2S2O3 in 150 ml of water). The
yellow homogeneous organic layer was then dried over anh. MgSO4,
filtered, and concentrated to dryness under reduced pressure to give the
crude product 2,4,5-triiodo-1H-imidazole as a yellow solid which was
further dried under HV (32.700 g; 100%). LC-MS: tR = 0.78 min.; [M+H]+ =
447.03 g/mol

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Synthesis of
1-Aryl-1H-imidazoles 1b-f. To a flame-dried reaction vessel were added
imidazole (13) (2.04 g, 30.0 mmol), 1,10-phenanthroline (3.60 g, 20.0
mmol), trans,trans-dibenzylidene acetone (dba) (0.23 g, 1.0 mmol), Cs2CO3
(7.17 g, 22.0 mmol), copper(I) trifluomethanesulfonate toluene complex
(0.52 g, 1.0 mmol), and an aryl iodide 2 (20.0 mmol), if a solid. The
reaction vessel was fitted with a silicon septum, evacuated, and
back-filled with argon, and this sequence was repeated twice. Xylenes (4
mL) and an aryl iodide 2 (20.0 mmol), if a liquid, were then added
successively under a stream of argon by syringe at room temperature. The
resulting mixture was stirred under argon at 110 °C until GLC analysis
showed that the reaction was complete (24-91 h). The resultant
heterogeneous mixture was allowed to cool to room temperature, diluted
with EtOAc, filtered through a plug of silica gel, and eluted with
additional EtOAc. The filtrate was concentrated under reduced pressure,
and the residue was purified by MPLC on silica gel to provide the desired
product. This procedure allowed us to prepare compounds 1b,d-f in 96-99%
yield. 1-(4-Methylthiophenyl)-1H-imidazole (1f). The crude reaction
product obtained from the copper(I)- catalyzed reaction of 13 with 2m was
purified by MPLC on silica gel with a mixture of CH2Cl2 and methanol (98
: 2) as eluent to give 1f (3.65 g, 96 %) as an orange solid: mp 92–93 °C
(lit4 93 °C); 1H NMR (200 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.82 (s, 1H), 7.32 (m, 4H), 7.25
(br s, 1H), 7.20 (br s, 1H), 2.51 (s, 3H); 13C NMR (50.3 MHz, CDCl3) δ
135.8, 135.4, 134.4, 130.2, 127.6 (2C), 121.8 (2C), 118.1, 15.9; IR (KBr)
ν max 3107, 1505, 1302, 1245, 1058, 817, 754 cm-1; EI-MS: m/z (%) 191
(12), 190 (100), 175 (32), 150 (9), 148 (31), 135 (10), 108 (8); Anal.
Calcd. for C10H10N2S: C, 63.13; H, 5.30. Found: C, 63.01; H, 5.17.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Regioselective synthesis of 1,5-diaryl-1H-imidazoles by
palladium-catalyzed direct arylation of 1-aryl-1H-imidazoles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Bellina, Fabio; Cauteruccio, Silvia; Mannina, Luisa; Rossi, Renzo; Viel,
Stephane
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2005), 70(10), 3997-4005

$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for the systhesis of diaryl
amines: A Schlenk tube equipped with a magnetic stir bar was charged with
p-toluidine (2a, 80 mg, 0.75 mmol), K2CO3 (138 mg, 1 mmol), Fe(acac) 3
(34.4 mg, 20% mol) and Cu(OAc)2·H2O (20 mg, 20% mol). Under a nitrogen
atmosphere, bromobenzene (1a, 0.5mmol, 78.0 mg) was added followed by dry
DMF (0.8 mL). The reaction mixture was then heated in an oil bath of
135°C. After being stirred at this temperature for 20 h, the mixture was
cooled to room temperature and diluted with diethyl ether. The resulting
suspension was directly filtered through a pad of celite and the filtrate
was concentrated and the crude mixtures were purified by column
chromatography on silica gel (300-400 mesh) using petroleum ether/ethyl
acetate solvent mixture as the eluent. 1-p-tolyl-1H-imidazole. Yield:
98%. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): 7.81 (s, 1H), 7.26 (s, 4H), 7.24 (s, 1H),
7.12 (s, 1H), 2.39 (s, 3H). 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3): 137.75, 135.87,
135.23, 130.65, 130.40, 121.68, 118.65, 21.26. HRMS (EI+): calcd for C10H
10 N2 (M+): 158.0844, found 158.0844.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Efficient iron/copper cocatalyzed N-arylation of arylamines with
bromoarenes
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Liu, Xiaoyan; Zhang, Songlin
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2011), (8), 1137-1142

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(2):AMD
$DATUM reaction products with sodium hydroxide and L-proline
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 960243-04-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(3):AMD
$DATUM polystyrene-supported
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Catalytic
N-Arylation of Nitrogen- Containing Heterocycles with Aryl and Heteroaryl
Halides. A flamedried Schlenk test tube with a magnetic stirring bar was
charged with CuI (9.5 mg, 0.05 mmol), 4a-2 (145 mg, 0.1 mmol of the
L-proline unit), K2CO3 (165 mg, 1.2 mmol), nitrogen-containing
heterocycle (0.5 mmol), aryl or heteroaryl halide (0.6 mmol), and DMSO (2
mL) under N2. A rubber septum was replaced with a glass stopper, and the
system was then evacuated three times and backfilled with N2. The
reaction mixture was stirred for 30 min at room temperature and then
heated at 120 °C for 60 h. The resulting mixture was cooled to ambient
temperature, diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate, filtered through a
plug of silica gel, and washed with 10-20 mL of ethyl acetate. The
filtrate was concentrated, and the resulting residue was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel to provide the desired product.
1-(4-Tolyl)-1H-imidazole (6f)1 Following the general procedure, imidazole
(0.034 g, 0.5 mmol) was coupled with4-bromotoluene (0.103 g, 0.6 mmol).
The crude product was purified over a silica gel column using ethyl
acetate/petrol ether (1/1) to give a white solid (98% yield). 1H NMR (600
MHz, CDCl3): δ 2.40 (s, 3H), 7.19 (s, 1H), 7.25 (s, 1H), 7.27 (bs, 4H),
7.82 (s, 1H) ppm. 13C NMR (150 MHz, CDCl3): δ 20.9, 118.3, 121.3, 130.1,
130.3, 134.9, 135.5, 137.4 ppm. GC-MS (EI, m/z): 158 [M+].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported catalyst (polymer-supported ionic liq.-copper complex)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A Concept of Supported Amino Acid Ionic Liquids and Their Application in
Metal Scavenging and Heterogeneous Catalysis
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Chen, Wen; Zhang, Yuanyuan; Zhu, Liangbo; Lan, Jingbo; Xie, Rugang; You,
Jingsong
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of the American Chemical Society (2007), 129(45), 13879-13886

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 30754-24-6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for N-Arylation of Imidazole
with Aryl Bromides. A Schlenk tube equipped with a Teflon stopcock are
charged with a magnetic stir bar, K2CO3 (572 mg, 2.1 mmol), CuI (0.38 mg,
0.20 mmol, 20 mol %), and per-6-amino- β -cyclodextrin (100 mg, 0.08
mmol, 8 mol %). DMSO (1 mL) was added at room temperature. Then a
solution of bromobenzene (188 mg, 1.2 mmol) and imidazole (68 mg, 1.0
mmol) in DMSO (1 mL) was added. The tube was sealed and the mixture was
allowed to stir for 24 h at 110°C. Water (5 mL) was added to the reaction
mixture after completion of the reaction. Then it was extracted with
ethyl acetate (3 × 20 mL) and the combined organic layers were dried with
anhydrous Na2SO4 and concentrated by vacuum. The residue was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel, using hexane/ethyl acetate (1:3) as
eluant, to give an oil of 1-phenylimidazole 4a (164 mg, 98%)
1-(4-Chlorophenyl)-1H-imidazole (4e), yield 99% 1H NMR (300 MHz): 7.85
(bs, 1H), 7.46 - 7.42 (m, 2H), 7.35-7.26 (m, 4H) 13C NMR (75 MHz): 135.7,
133.0, 131.9, 130.5, 129.9, 122.6, 118.1 GC-MS: m/z 177.8 (M+)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM sealed tube used, Ullmann reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Per-6-amino-β-cyclodextrin as an Efficient Supramolecular Ligand and Host
for Cu(I)-Catalyzed N-Arylation of Imidazole with Aryl Bromides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Suresh, Palaniswamy; Pitchumani, Kasi
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2008), 73(22), 9121-9124

$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-(2-Nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole (2e); Typical
Procedure. A mixture of 1-chloro-2-nitrobenzene (1 mmol), 1H-imidazole
(1.2 mmol), K2CO3 (1.2 mmol), and Cu/Al-HTB (100 mg, 2.5 mol%) in DMF (2
mL) was stirred in a round-bottomed flask at 100 °C. When the reaction
was complete (TLC), the catalyst was filtered washed several times with
DMF, H2O and acetone and reused for the next reaction. DMF was removed
from the reaction filtrate under reduced pressure and crude material was
purified by chromatography (silica gel, 60-120 mesh, hexane-EtOAc) to
afford 2e.11 Product 2m. Yield 98%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM green chemistry-catalyst
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Cu-Al hydrotalcite: an efficient and reusable ligand-free catalyst for
the coupling of aryl chlorides with aliphatic, aromatic, and
N(H)-heterocyclic amines
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DATUM Preparations and characterisation data Im-hq*H2. As is recently described
in detail elsewhere,1 this compound, a white powder, was easily obtained
in almost quantitative yield from the conjugate addition of imidazole to
2-acetyl-5-t-butyl-1,4-benzoquinone, followed by reduction of the acetyl
group with triethylsilane in trifluoroacetic acid. Found: C, 66.29; H,
7.38; N, 10.33 %. C15H20N2O2.0.5H2O requires C, 66.89; H, 7.86; N, 10.40
%. m/z (ESI-MS) 260 (M+, 80 %), 245 (100), 233 (45), 218 (40), 69 (50),
41 (55); λmax/nm (CH3CN) 293 (ε/L mol-1cm-1 5662), 215 (5825); δH
[(CD3)2CO] 7.92 (1H, s, OH), 7.42 (1H, s, Im), 7.31 (1H, s, OH), 7.05
(1H, d, Im), 7.03 (1H, d, Im), 6.96 (1H, s, Ar), 2.13 (2H, q, CH2), 1.39
(9H, s, t-Bu), 0.96 (3H, t, CH3); δC [(CD3)2CO] 159.97, 159.31, 147.55,

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 99
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1317-38-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-56-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-56-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM methyl 3-chloro-6-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)-8-(trifluoromethyl)imidazo[1,
2-a]pyridine-2- carboxylate Methyl 3-chloro-6-(4,4,5,5-tetramethyl-1
,3,2-dioxaborolan-2-yl)-8- (trifluoromethyl)imidazo[1
,2-a]pyridine-2-carboxylate (1.5 g, 3.7 mmol), copper (I) oxide (0.265 g,
1.85 mmol), and (0.303 g, 4.45 mmol) in methanol (10 mL) were stirred at
room temperature for 1 day. LC-MS showed no conversion. Air was bubbled
through the reaction and then heated to 35-40 °C. No conversion was
observed after 2 hours. The mixture was allowed to cool to room
temperature. One drop of water was added and the mixture allowed to stir
over the weekend. The reaction had gone dry over the weekend. Methanol (5
mL) was added and the mixture continued to stir for 2 hours. LC-MS showed
a small amount of desired product had formed. An additional 0.4
equivalents of copper (I) oxide (0.21g, 1.5 mmol) were added and the
mixture continued to stir at room temperature overnight. LC-MS showed
-50% conversion. An additional 0.5 equivalents of copper (I) oxide
(265mg, 1 .85mmol) was added and the mixture continued to stir at room
temperature. After 24 hours, the reaction was filtered through a pad of
Celite, washed with methanol and dichloromethane, and the filtrate
concentrated to give the title compound (1.6 g, >99%, 79% purity) as a
solid. ES-LCMS m/z: 345, 347 (M+1 ).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM incremental addition copper oxide

$DATUM Step B. Methyl
3-chloro-6-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)-8-(trifluoromethyl)imidazo[1,2-a]pyridine-2-carboxylate.
Methyl
3-chloro-6-(4,4,5,5-tetramethyl-1,3,2-dioxaborolan-2-yl)-8-(trifluoromethyl)imidazo[1,2-a]pyridine-2-carboxylate
(1.5 g, 3.7 mmol), copper (I) oxide (0.265 g, 1.85 mmol), and imidazole
(0.303 g, 4.45 mmol) in methanol (10 ml) were stirred at room temperature
for 1 day. LC-MS showed no conversion. Air was bubbled through the
reaction and then heated to 35-40 °C. No conversion was observed after 2
hours. The mixture was allowed to cool to room temperature. One drop of
water was added and the mixture allowed to stir over the weekend. The
reaction had gone dry over the weekend. Methanol (5 mL) was added and the
mixture continued to stir for 2 hours. LC-MS showed a small amount of
desired product had formed. An additional 0.4 equivalents of copper (1)
oxide (0.21g, 1.5 mmol) were added and the mixture continued to stir at
room temperature overnight. LC-MS showed ∼50% conversion. An additional
0.5 equivalents of copper (1) oxide (265mg, 1.85mmol) was added and the
mixture continued to stir at room temperature. After 24 hours, the
reaction was filtered through a pad of celite, the pad of celite washed
with methanol and dichloromethane, and the filtrate concentrated to give
the title compound (1.6 g, <99%, 79% purity) as a solid. ES-LCMS: m/z
345, 347 (M+1).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical procedure for the NHC-catalyzed
formylation of N–H bonds, synthesis of formamide derivatives 2a-2z The
typical procedure is detailed for the conversion of morpholine to 2a
using IPr as catalyst and PhSiH3 as silane (synthesis of 2a in Scheme 1).
A 16 mL J. Young Schlenk flask, equipped with a magnetic stir bar and a
J. Young valve, is charged with IPr (19.6 mg, 0.050 mmol, 5 mol%),
morpholine 1a (88 μL, 1.00 mmol, 1 eq), phenylsilane (124 μL, 1,00 mmol,
1 eq) and THF (2.0 mL). The reaction mixture is degassed and exposed to a
carbon dioxide pressure (P=1 bar). The flask is sealed and stirred for 24
h at RT. The crude mixture is then purified by flash chromatography on
silica gel (0.069-0.200 mm, standard grade): silicium byproducts
(siloxanes) are first recovered using THF as the eluent and the formamide
is then purified by flash chromatography on silica gel (0.069-0.200 mm,
standard grade): silicium byproducts (siloxanes) are first recovered
using THF as the eluent and the formamide is then collected as an
analytically pure liquid using ethyl acetate as the eluent. The
corresponding formamide is identified and its yield determined by 1H NMR
in d6 -benzene and/or GC/MS analysis (using Ph2 as an internal standard)
by comparison with analytically pure samples.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM green chemistry (waste recycling)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Recycling of carbon and silicon wastes: room temperature formylation of
N-H bonds using carbon dioxide and polymethylhydrosiloxane

$DATUM 1310-58-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-05-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 1,3-Bis(imidazolylmethyl)-5-methoxybenzene (6). Potassium hydroxide (0.46
g, 8.16 mmol) and 1H-imidazole (0.46 g, 6.80 mmol) were stirred
vigorously in dry MeCN (120 mL) at room temperature under an argon
atmosphere for 1 h until a solution was obtained. A solution of
1,3-bis(bromomethyl)-5-methoxybenzene (5) (1.00 g, 3.40 mmol) in dry MeCN
(30 mL) was added, the reaction mixture turned turbid and the stirring
was continued for 15 h at room temperature. After this time, the
suspension was filtered and the solid was washed with CH2Cl2 (6 mL). The
solution was concentrated in the rotary evaporator and then the residue
was dissolved in CH2Cl2 (250 mL). The organic solution was washed with
water (3 x 150 mL), dried over MgSO4, filtered and evaporated in vacuum
to give 6. As a yellow oil (0.91 g, 99%). 6: 1HNMR (400 MHz, CDCl3, 25 C,
TMS): δ 3.73 (s, 3H, OCH3), 5.06 (s, 4H, CH2), 6.52 (s, 1H, ArH(2)), 6.59
(s, 2H, Ar-H(4,6)), 6.89 (s, 2H, Im-H(5)/Im-H(4)), 7.09 (s, 2H,
Im-H(4)/Im-H(5)), 7.53 (s, 2H, Im-H(2)). 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3, 25 C,
TMS): δ 50.6 (CH2), 55.6 (OCH3), 112.7 (ArC(4,6)), 118.2 (Ar-C(2)), 119.5
(Im-C(4)/(5)), 130.2 (Im-C(4)/(5)), 137.6 (Im-C(2)), 138.9 (Ar-C-(1,3)),
160.9 (Ar-C(5)). MS (EI) m/z: (160.1, [M (CH2Im), (OCH3)]+ 79%), (186.1,
[M (CH2Im)]+ 56%), (201.1, [M Im]+ 59%), (268.1, [M]+, 100%). HRMS (ESI)
m/z: (C15H16N4O + H)+ calculated 269.1396, found 269.1408. Rf: 0.44
(MeOH:CH2Cl2, 1:9). Mp: 7175 C.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Gemini Imidazolium Amphiphiles for the Synthesis, Stabilization, and Drug
Delivery from Gold Nanoparticles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Preparation of
5-(2-ethoxy-5-(4-methylpiperazinylsulfony
l)phenyl)-1-methy3-n-propyl,6-dihydro-7H-pyrrolo[4,3-d]pyrimidin-7-one (a
compound of the formula (1) wherein R5 = SO2NR6R7, R1 = CH3, R2 = H, R3 =
CH2CH2CH3, R4 = CH2CH3; NR6R7 is 4-methylpiperazinyl) To a mixture of
5-(5-chlorosulfony2-ethoxyphenyl)-1-methy3-n-propyl,6-dihydro-7H-pyrrolo[4,3-d]pyrimidin-7-one
(170 mg, 0. 41 mmol) and 1-methylpiperazine (69 pL, 0. 62 mmol) in
anliydrous CH2Cl2 (10 mL) or EtOH (10 mL) was added triethylamine (115
μL, 0. 83 mmol), and the mixture was stirred at room temperature under
nitrogen atmosphere for 1-12 h. The reaction mixture was evaporated to
dryness under reduced pressure, and the resulting yellow residue was
purHied by MPLC on silica gel (gradient elution: 2% MeOH in CHCl3
followed by 3% MeOH in CHCl3) to aHord the titled compound. Analytically
pure compound was obtained by crystallization from EtOAc/hexanes.
Preparation of
5-(5-(1-imidazolosulfonyl)-2-n-propoxyphenyl)-1-methy3-n-propyl,6-dihydro-7H-pyrrolo[4,3-d]pyrimidin-7-one
(a compound of the formula (1) wherein R5 = S 0 2NR6R7, R1 = CH3, R2 = H,
R3 = CH2CH2CH3, R4 = CH2CH2CH3; NR6R7 is 1-imidazolo) The titled compound
was prepared as described in Example 1 by using
5-(5-chlorosulfony2-n-propoxyphenyl)-1-methy3-H-propyl,6-dihydro-7H-pyrrolo
[4,3-d]pyrimidin-7-one and imidazole in place of
5-(5-chlorosulfony2-ethoxyphenyl)-1-methy3-n-propyl,6-dihydro-7H-pyrrolo[4,3-d]pyrimidin-7-one
and 1-methylpiperazine. yleld: 99%. mp 163-164 °C (CHCl3/Et2O/hexanes);
IR (neat) 3116 (NH), 1668 (C=O), 1184 (SO2) cm-1; 1HNMR (CDCl3/TMS) δ 1.
04 (t, J = 7. 5 Hz, 3 H, CH2CH2CH3), 1. 17 (t, J = 7. 5 Hz, 5 3 H,
OCH2CH2CH3), 1. 70-1. 82 (m , 2 H, CH2CH2CH3), 1. 97-2. 08 (m, 2 H,
OCH2CH2CH3), 2. 75 (t, J = 7. 5 Hz, 2 H, CH2CH2CH3), 4. 08 (s, 3 H,
NCH3), 4. 25 (t, J = 6. 6 Hz, 2 H, OCH2CH2CH3), 6. 91 (s, 1 H, H-2), 7.
11 (s, 1 H, ImH-4), 7. 15 (d, J = 9.0 Hz, 1 H, H-3'), 7. 35 (s, 1 H,
ImH-5), 7. 96 (dd, J = 9. 0 Hz, 2. 7 Hz, 1 H, H-4'), 8. 06 (s, 1 H,
ImH-2), 9. 07 (d, J = 2. 7 Hz, 1 H, H-6'), 10. 55 (br s, 1 H, NH); MS
(FAB) m/z 456 (MH+).

$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Step 1: To a solution of imidazole (6.8 g, 100 mmol) in CH2Cl2 (500 mL)
was added cyanogen bromide (11 mL of 3M in CH2Cl2, 33 mmol) and the
resultant mixture was heated under nitrogen at reflux for 30 minutes. The
reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature and filtered. The
filtrate was concentrated to 50 mL and crystallized in the freezer for 2
days. The solid was collected by filtration, washed with cold CH2Cl2 and
dried under vacuum to afford (di-imidazol-1-yl)-methyleneamine. Yield 5.3
g, 99%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM Brotherton-Pleiss, Christine E.; Walker, Keith A. M.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 2.1. 1-(2-Hydroxy-2-methyl-n-propyl)imidazole (1). Imidazole (2.00 g,
29.37 mmol) and isobutylene oxide (2.90 mL, 32.31 mmol) was stirred at 55
°C in reaction vial for 12 h. The resulting thick liquid was dried under
high vacuum at room temperature to afford 4.07 g (99%) of 1 as a
colorless liquid: 1-(2-Hydroxy-2-methyl-n-propyl)imidazole (1), yield
4.07 g (99%) 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 1.22 (s, 6H), 3.87 (s, 2H), 4.21
(br, 1H), 6.93-6.98 (m, 2H), 7.48 (s, 1H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ
27.0, 58.0, 69.7, 120.5, 127.9, 138.0; MS (EI) 140 (M+), 82 (100), 59.
HRMS (EI) calcd for C7H12N2O (M+) 140.0950, found 140.0949. Copies of 1H
and 13C NMR spectra are in this SI. Known compound. See Arnold, P. L.;
Rodden, M.; Davis, K. M.; Scarisbrick, A. C.; Blake, A. J.;Wilson, C.
Chem. Commun. 2004, 1612-1613
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM no solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synergistic Effect of Two Solvents, tert-Alcohol and Ionic Liquid, in One
Molecule in Nucleophilic Fluorination
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Shinde, Sandip S.; Lee, Byoung Se; Chi, Dae Yoon
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organic Letters (2008), 10(5), 733-735

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure B: Coupling of Aryl Bromides
with Amines or N-Containing Heterocycles (5.0 mmol scale). An oven-dried
Schlenk tube equipped with a Teflon valve (Kontes) was charged with a
magnetic stir bar, CuBr (7.2 mg, 0.05 mmol, 1 mol %), the L5 (16 mg, 0.1
mmol, 2 mol %), and Cs2CO3 (3.25 g, 10.0 mmol). Any remaining solids
(amine and/or aryl bromide) were added at this point. The tube was
evacuated and backfilled with argon (this procedure was repeated three
times). Under a counter flow of argon, amine (7.5 mmol) (if liquid), aryl
bromide (5.0 mmol) (if liquid), and DMSO (5.0 mL) were added by syringe.
Finally, the tube was sealed and the mixture was heated at the indicated
temperature (90-110 °C) for the indicated period of time. Upon completion
of the reaction, the mixture was allowed to cool to room temperature and
then was diluted with ethyl acetate and passed through a fritted glass
filter to remove the inorganic salts, then the solvent was removed with
the aid of a rotary evaporator. The residue was purified by column
chromatography on silica gel and the product was dried under vacuum for
at least 1 h. 1-(4-Nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole (5k):19e Following procedure
B, 1-bromo-4-nitrobenzene (1.01 g, 5.0 mmol) was allowed to react with
1H-imidazole (510 mg, 7.5 mmol) for 15 h at 90 °C. The crude brown oil
was purified by flash chromatography on silica gel to provide 99% yield
of the desired product as a pale-yellow solid. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ
8.23 (dt, J= 9.2, 2.8 Hz, 2H), 7.91 (s, 1H), 7.50 (dt, J= 8.8, 3.2 Hz,
2H), 7.31 (s, 1H), 7.12 (s, 2H) ppm; 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3) δ 145.9,
141.7, 135.2, 131.3, 125.4, 120.7, 117.4 ppm.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM chemoselective, sealed tube used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Ligands for Copper-Catalyzed C-N Bond Forming Reactions with 1 Mol% CuBr
as Catalyst
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Yang, Kai; Qiu, Yatao; Li, Zheng; Wang, Zhaoyang; Jiang, Sheng
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2011), 76(9), 3151-3159

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Hf(OTf)4-Catalyzed
Aminomethylation of a Nitrogen-Containing Heterocycle with an N,O-Acetal.
To a freshly distilled CH2Cl2 solution (2 mL) was successively added an
N,O-acetal 2 (70.3 mg, 0.600 mmol), indole (70.3 mg, 0.600 mmol), and
Hf(OTf)4 (23.2 mg, 0.0300 mmol) under a nitrogen atmosphere. The
resulting solution was stirred for 0.1 h at room temperature. The
reaction was quenched with a saturated aqueous solution (2 mL) of Na2CO3.
The combined organic layer was dried over MgSO4 and evaporated under
reduced pressure. The crude product was purified by silica gel column
chromatography (hexane/AcOEt) to afford the corresponding product.
N-((1H-Imidazol-1-yl)methyl)-N-ethylethanamine (8): 99% yield; colorless
oil; IR (neat) 2971, 1204, 1068 cm-1; 1H NMR (500 MHz CDCl3) δ 1.10 (t,
6H, J = 7.0 Hz), 2.55 (q, 4H, J = 7.0 Hz), 4.82 (s, 2H), 6.95 (s, 1H),
7.07 (s, 1H), 7.50 (s, 1H); 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3) δ 12.5, 45.0, 63.8,
119.3, 128.9, 137.3; MS (ESI): m/z 154 (M++H); HRMS (ESI): Calcd for
C8H16N3: 154.1344, Found: 154.1350.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM chemoselective
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Hf(OTf)4-Catalyzed Regioselective N-Aminomethylation of Indoles and
Related NH-Containing Heterocycles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Sakai, Norio; Shimamura, Kazuyori; Ikeda, Reiko; Konakahara, Takeo
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2010), 75(11), 3923-3926

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure. An oven-dried 25 mL
round-bottomed flask with a magnetic stirring bar was charged with CuI
nanoparticles (1.25 mol %), K2CO3 (0.1662 g, 1.2 mmol),
nitrogencontaining heterocycle (1.2 mmol)/phenol (1.2 mmol), aryl
chloride (1.0 mmol), and DMF (1 mL) under air. The reaction mixture was
stirred for 30 min at room temperature and then transferred to a
preheated oil bath at 110 °C. At the end of the reaction, as judged by
TLC, the reaction mixture was then cooled to room temperature, diluted
with 2-3 mL of EtOAc, and centrifuged to remove the catalyst, and the
catalyst was further washed with 5-10 mL of EtOAc to make it free from
organic matter. The combined organic extracts were then concentrated
under reduced pressure, and the resulting residue was purified by column
chromatography on silica gel (60-120) using hexane/ethyl acetate (80:20)
eluent to provide the desired N-arylated/ O-arylated product. The
catalyst was oven-dried at 65 °C for 2 h and reused.
1-(4-bromophenyl)-1H-imidazole (Table 2, Entry 11): Yellow solid, 99 %.
1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3, ppm): δ 6.66-7.04 (m, 2H), 7.31 (d, J = 8.4 Hz,
2H), 7.38-7.44 (m, 2H), 7.68 (s, 1H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3, ppm): δ
115.7, 122.6, 124.6, 130.2, 132.6, 135.1, 135.4. EI-MS: m/z = 223 (M+).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM CuI nanoparticles used as cat..
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM CuI Nanoparticles for C-N and C-O Cross Coupling of Heterocyclic Amines
and Phenols with Chlorobenzenes
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Sreedhar, B.; Arundhathi, R.; Reddy, P. Linga; Kantam, M. Lakshmi
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(20), 7951-7954

$DATUM 960242-97-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(2):AMD
$DATUM reaction products with sodium hydroxide and L-proline
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 960243-04-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(3):AMD
$DATUM polystyrene-supported
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Catalytic
N-Arylation of Nitrogen- Containing Heterocycles with Aryl and Heteroaryl
Halides. A flamedried Schlenk test tube with a magnetic stirring bar was
charged with CuI (9.5 mg, 0.05 mmol), 4a-2 (145 mg, 0.1 mmol of the
L-proline unit), K2CO3 (165 mg, 1.2 mmol), nitrogen-containing
heterocycle (0.5 mmol), aryl or heteroaryl halide (0.6 mmol), and DMSO (2
mL) under N2. A rubber septum was replaced with a glass stopper, and the
system was then evacuated three times and backfilled with N2. The
reaction mixture was stirred for 30 min at room temperature and then
heated at 120 °C for 60 h. The resulting mixture was cooled to ambient
temperature, diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate, filtered through a
plug of silica gel, and washed with 10-20 mL of ethyl acetate. The
filtrate was concentrated, and the resulting residue was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel to provide the desired product.
3-Imidazol-1-yl-phenylamine (6l)3 Following the general procedure,
imidazole (0.034 g, 0.5 mmol) was coupled with 3-bromoaniline (66 µL, 0.6
mmol). The crude product was purified over a silica gelcolumn using ethyl
acetate/petrol ether (1/1) to give a light yellow solid (99% yield). 1H
NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 4.00 (bs, 2H), 6.63-6.65 (m, 2H), 6.71-6.73 (m,
1H), 7.17-7.23 (m, 3H), 7.81 (s, 1H) ppm. 13C NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3): δ
107.7, 111.1, 113.9, 118.3, 130.0, 130.6, 135.6, 138.3, 148.1 ppm. GC-MS
(EI, m/z): 159 [M+].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported catalyst (polymer-supported ionic liq.-copper complex)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A Concept of Supported Amino Acid Ionic Liquids and Their Application in
Metal Scavenging and Heterogeneous Catalysis
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Chen, Wen; Zhang, Yuanyuan; Zhu, Liangbo; Lan, Jingbo; Xie, Rugang; You,
Jingsong
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of the American Chemical Society (2007), 129(45), 13879-13886

$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-(2-Nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole (2e); Typical
Procedure. A mixture of 1-chloro-2-nitrobenzene (1 mmol), 1H-imidazole
(1.2 mmol), K2CO3 (1.2 mmol), and Cu/Al-HTB (100 mg, 2.5 mol%) in DMF (2
mL) was stirred in a round-bottomed flask at 100 °C. When the reaction
was complete (TLC), the catalyst was filtered washed several times with
DMF, H2O and acetone and reused for the next reaction. DMF was removed
from the reaction filtrate under reduced pressure and crude material was
purified by chromatography (silica gel, 60-120 mesh, hexane-EtOAc) to
afford 2e.11 1-(2-Nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole (2e). Yield 99%. 1H NMR (300
MHz, CDCl3): δ = 7.36-7.56 (m, 6 H), 7.85 (d, J = 7.93 Hz, 1 H). 13C NMR
(75 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 122.0, 124.1, 124.6, 125.5, 129.9, 132.0, 135.5,
137.4, 139.9. MS (EI): m/z = 43, 57, 83, 85, 109, 115, 128, 149, 164,
171, 189 (M+). Anal. Calcd for C9H7N3O2: C, 57.14; H, 3.73; N, 22.21.
Found: C, 57.15; H, 3.69; N, 22.30.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM green chemistry-catalyst
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Cu-Al hydrotalcite: an efficient and reusable ligand-free catalyst for
the coupling of aryl chlorides with aliphatic, aromatic, and
N(H)-heterocyclic amines
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Sreedhar, B.; Arundhathi, R.; Reddy, P. Linga; Reddy, M. Amarnath;
Kantam, M. Lakshmi
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2009), (15), 2517-2522

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Experimental Procedure: A mixture of
4-bromotoluene (1 mmol), imidazole (1.2 mmol), K2CO3 (2 mmol) and
Cu(II)-NaY (100 mg) in DMF (3 mL) was heated to 120 °C for the specified
time (Table 2). The progress of the reaction was monitored by GC or TLC.
The reaction mixture was filtered to separate the catalyst and the
filtrate was quenched with aq NaHCO3 and the product extracted with
EtOAc. The combined organic layers were washed with brine, dried over
Na2SO4 and concentrated. The residue was purified by column
chromatography to afford pure 1-(4-methylphenyl)-1H-imidazole. Table 2
Entry 2, yield 99%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM Cu(II)-NaY zeolite catalyst used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A mild and efficient method for N-arylation of nitrogen heterocycles with
aryl halides catalyzed by Cu(II)-NaY zeolite
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kantam, M. Lakshmi; Rao, B. Purna Chandra; Choudary, B. M.; Reddy, R.
Sudarshan
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2006), (14), 2195-2198

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Experimental Procedure: A mixture of
4-bromotoluene (1 mmol), imidazole (1.2 mmol), K2CO3 (2 mmol) and
Cu(II)-NaY (100 mg) in DMF (3 mL) was heated to 120 °C for the specified
time (Table 2). The progress of the reaction was monitored by GC or TLC.
The reaction mixture was filtered to separate the catalyst and the
filtrate was quenched with aq NaHCO3 and the product extracted with
EtOAc. The combined organic layers were washed with brine, dried over
Na2SO4 and concentrated. The residue was purified by column
chromatography to afford pure 1-(4-methylphenyl)-1H-imidazole. Table 2
Entry 10, yield 99%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM Cu(II)-NaY zeolite catalyst used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A mild and efficient method for N-arylation of nitrogen heterocycles with
aryl halides catalyzed by Cu(II)-NaY zeolite
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kantam, M. Lakshmi; Rao, B. Purna Chandra; Choudary, B. M.; Reddy, R.
Sudarshan
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2006), (14), 2195-2198

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-(2-Nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole (2e); Typical
Procedure. A mixture of 1-chloro-2-nitrobenzene (1 mmol), 1H-imidazole
(1.2 mmol), K2CO3 (1.2 mmol), and Cu/Al-HTB (100 mg, 2.5 mol%) in DMF (2
mL) was stirred in a round-bottomed flask at 100 °C. When the reaction
was complete (TLC), the catalyst was filtered washed several times with
DMF, H2O and acetone and reused for the next reaction. DMF was removed
from the reaction filtrate under reduced pressure and crude material was
purified by chromatography (silica gel, 60-120 mesh, hexane-EtOAc) to
afford 2e.11 Product 2m. Yield 99%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Experimental Procedure: A mixture of
4-bromotoluene (1 mmol), imidazole (1.2 mmol), K2CO3 (2 mmol) and
Cu(II)-NaY (100 mg) in DMF (3 mL) was heated to 120 °C for the specified
time (Table 2). The progress of the reaction was monitored by GC or TLC.
The reaction mixture was filtered to separate the catalyst and the
filtrate was quenched with aq NaHCO3 and the product extracted with
EtOAc. The combined organic layers were washed with brine, dried over
Na2SO4 and concentrated. The residue was purified by column
chromatography to afford pure 1-(4-methylphenyl)-1H-imidazole.
N-(4-chlorophenyl)imidazole, yield 99%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM chemoselective, Cu(II)-NaY zeolite catalyst used

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Synthesis of
1-Aryl-1H-imidazoles 1b-f. To a flame-dried reaction vessel were added
imidazole (13) (2.04 g, 30.0 mmol), 1,10-phenanthroline (3.60 g, 20.0
mmol), trans,trans-dibenzylidene acetone (dba) (0.23 g, 1.0 mmol), Cs2CO3
(7.17 g, 22.0 mmol), copper(I) trifluomethanesulfonate toluene complex
(0.52 g, 1.0 mmol), and an aryl iodide 2 (20.0 mmol), if a solid. The
reaction vessel was fitted with a silicon septum, evacuated, and
back-filled with argon, and this sequence was repeated twice. Xylenes (4
mL) and an aryl iodide 2 (20.0 mmol), if a liquid, were then added
successively under a stream of argon by syringe at room temperature. The
resulting mixture was stirred under argon at 110 °C until GLC analysis
showed that the reaction was complete (24-91 h). The resultant
heterogeneous mixture was allowed to cool to room temperature, diluted
with EtOAc, filtered through a plug of silica gel, and eluted with
additional EtOAc. The filtrate was concentrated under reduced pressure,
and the residue was purified by MPLC on silica gel to provide the desired
product. This procedure allowed us to prepare compounds 1b,d-f in 96-99%
yield. 1-(4-Chlorophenyl)-1H-imidazole (1e). The crude reaction product
obtained from the copper(I)- catalyzed reaction of 13 with 2f was
purified by MPLC on silica gel with a mixture of CH2Cl2 and methanol (98
: 2) as eluent to give 1e (3.43 g, 96 %) as a light brown solid: mp
84–86°C (lit3 mp 85–87 °C) ; 1H NMR (200 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.75 (s, 1H), 7.37
(m, 2H), 7.25 (m, 2H), 7.17 (s, 1H), 7.13 (s, 1H); 13C NMR (50.3 MHz,
CDCl3) δ 135.8, 135.3, 132.9, 130.5, 129.8 (2C), 122.5 (2C), 118.0; IR
(KBr) ν max 3108, 1506, 1303, 1239, 1058, 830, 768 cm-1; EI-MS: m/z (%)
180 (32), 179 (11), 178 (100), 151 (57), 124 (26), 111 (24), 75 (23);
Anal. Calcd. for C9H7ClN2: C, 60.52; H, 3.95. Found: C, 60.39; H, 3.83.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Regioselective synthesis of 1,5-diaryl-1H-imidazoles by
palladium-catalyzed direct arylation of 1-aryl-1H-imidazoles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Experimental Procedure: A mixture of
4-bromotoluene (1 mmol), imidazole (1.2 mmol), K2CO3 (2 mmol) and
Cu(II)-NaY (100 mg) in DMF (3 mL) was heated to 120 °C for the specified
time (Table 2). The progress of the reaction was monitored by GC or TLC.
The reaction mixture was filtered to separate the catalyst and the
filtrate was quenched with aq NaHCO3 and the product extracted with
EtOAc. The combined organic layers were washed with brine, dried over
Na2SO4 and concentrated. The residue was purified by column
chromatography to afford pure 1-(4-methylphenyl)-1H-imidazole. Table 2
Entry 11, yield 99%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General Procedure for the Synthesis of 1-Aryl-1H-imidazoles 1b-f. To a
flame-dried reaction vessel were added imidazole (13) (2.04 g, 30.0
mmol), 1,10-phenanthroline (3.60 g, 20.0 mmol), trans,trans-dibenzylidene
acetone (dba) (0.23 g, 1.0 mmol), Cs2CO3 (7.17 g, 22.0 mmol), copper(I)
trifluomethanesulfonate toluene complex (0.52 g, 1.0 mmol), and an aryl
iodide 2 (20.0 mmol), if a solid. The reaction vessel was fitted with a
silicon septum, evacuated, and back-filled with argon, and this sequence
was repeated twice. Xylenes (4 mL) and an aryl iodide 2 (20.0 mmol), if a
liquid, were then added successively under a stream of argon by syringe
at room temperature. The resulting mixture was stirred under argon at 110
°C until GLC analysis showed that the reaction was complete (24-91 h).
The resultant heterogeneous mixture was allowed to cool to room
temperature, diluted with EtOAc, filtered through a plug of silica gel,
and eluted with additional EtOAc. The filtrate was concentrated under
reduced pressure, and the residue was purified by MPLC on silica gel to
provide the desired product. This procedure allowed us to prepare
compounds 1b,d-f in 96-99% yield. 1-(4-Methoxyphenyl)-1H-imidazole (1b).
The crude reaction product obtained from the copper(I)- catalyzed
reaction of 13 with 2a was purified by MPLC on silica gel with a mixture
of CH2Cl2 and methanol (97 : 3) as eluent to give 1b (3.34 g, 96 %) as a
light brown solid: mp 62–63 °C (lit1 mp 60–61 °C); 1H NMR (200 MHz,
CDCl3) δ 7.76 (s, 1H), 7.23 (m, 2H), 7.20 (s, 1H), 7.18 (s, 1H), 6.98 (m,
2H), 3.84 (s, 3H); 13C NMR (50.3 MHz, CDCl3) δ 158.7, 135.7, 129.9,
129.6, 123.0 (2C), 118.6, 114.7 (2C), 55.5; IR (KBr) ν max 3108, 1506,
1303, 1239, 1093, 1058, 830 cm-1; EI-MS: m/z (%) 175 (12), 174 (100), 159
(15), 147 (10), 134 (10), 132 (38), 77 (13); Anal. Calcd. For C10H10N2O:
C, 68.95; H, 5.79, Found: C, 68.82; H, 5.68.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-05-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM EXAMPLE 19 Synthesis of
1-amino-6-cyclohexyl-4-imidazole-1-yl-1H-pyridine-2-one (Compound 19) a)
Synthesis of 6-cyclohexyl-4-imidazole-1-yl-1H-pyridine-2-one
4-Bromo-6-cyclohexyl-pyrane-2-one (2.18g, 9.727mmol) and imidazole
(1.98g, 29.2mmol) were dissolved in CH3CN (100mL) in a 250mL flask. After
K2CO3 (4.03g, 29.181mmol) and KI (161mg, 0.972mmol) were added thereto,
the reaction solution was heated under reflux. After 8 hours, the
solution was cooled down to room temperature, filtered, and the filtrate
was concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel using MC:MeOH (30:1) as eluent. The
fractions containing the product were combined and evaporated to give a
milky solid (2.36g, 99%). 1η-NMR(CDCl3); δ = 8.1(s, 1H), 7.3(d, 1H),
6.15(d, 1H), 2.5(m, 1H), 2.15-1.1 (m, 10H). MS(ESI); 245(M++1).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Substituted 1H-pyridin-2-one derivatives useful as inhibitors of PDE4,
and their preparation, pharmaceutical compositions, and use, particularly
for treatment of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Koo, Bon Am; Nam, Woong Hyun; Hong, Woo Sang; Seo, Hyoung Sik
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2004050624 A1 2004-06-17

$DATUM Sodium hydride (14.4 g of a 60% dispersion) was suspended in THF (125
ml). The solution was cooled to 0 °C and a solution of imidazole (34 g,
500 mmol) in THF (250 ml) was added over 15 min, and more THF (250 ml)
was added. After stirring for 10 min at 0 °C, a solution of carbon
disulfide (46.7 g, 600 mmol) in THF (100 ml) was added over 2 min. After
stirring for 30 min at 0 °C, a solution of methyl iodide (90.2 g, 550
mmol) in THF (100 ml) was added, and the reaction was stirred for 40 min
at 0 °C 10 ml of water was added very slowly to quench any unreacted NaH.
The THF was removed under vacuum and AcOEt (500 ml) was added. The
solution was washed with 5% AcOH/water and water (200 ml each), dried
over Na2SO4, and concentrated under vacuum to yield a two-phase oil. The
higher density oil was isolated using a separatory funnel to yield a
yellow oil, imidazole-1 - carbodithioic acid methyl ester, yield 78.8 g,
99%. 1H-NMR (CDCI3, 400 MHz): δ 2.80 (s, 3 H), 7.12 (s, 1 H), 7.79 (s, 1
H), 8.50 (s, 1 H). 13C-NMR (CDCI3, 400 MHz): δ 19.70, 117.68, 131.26,
135.56, 198.88.

$DATUM tert-Butyl 2-oxo-2-phenylacetate (3)5 A solution of oxalyl chloride (2.0
mL, 23.6 mmol, 1 equiv) in anhydrous THF (62 mL, 0.38 M) was cooled to 0
°C under inert atmosphere. Tert-butanol was added and the resulting
reaction mixture was stirred for 1 h at 0 °C. Imidazole (4.82 mg, 70.8
mmol, 3 equiv) dissolved in THF (2.0 mL) was added via drop-funnel over
30 min, stirred for an additional 15 min at the 0 °C. The reaction was
then warmed up to rt, then filtered. The resulting filtrate was
concentrated to yield tert-butyl 2-(1H-idazol-1-yl)-2-oxoacetate. Yellow
oil (4.60 g, 99% yield). 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.38 (s, 1H), 7.62 (t,
J = 1.4 Hz, 1H), 7.15-7.14 (m, 1H), 1.64 (s, 9H).

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Representative example 5: 1-Phenyl-1H-imidazol
12a:15 To a suspension of resin 7a (220 mg, 0.23 mmol) in THF (2 ml) were
added imidazole (13 mg, 0.20 mmol) and copper(II) acetate (4 mg, 0.02
mmol), the mixture was stirred for 24 hours at 50 °C. The reaction
mixture was filtered and the resin was washed with THF (3 x 2 ml). The
combined filtrates were concentrated in vacuo.. Flash chromatography of
the residue (eluent: ethylacetate) yielded 12a, 28 mg (83%).
1-(4-Methylphenyl)-1H-imidazol 12c:17 Prepared from resin 7c. 1H-NMR δ
2.40 (3H, s), 7.19 (1H, s), 7.25 (1H, s), 7.27 (4H, s), 7.82 (1H, s).
13C-NMR δ 21.4, 118.8, 121.9, 130.6, 130.8, 135.4, 136.1, 137.9.

$DATUM 12304-65-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-(2-Nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole (2e); Typical
Procedure. A mixture of 1-chloro-2-nitrobenzene (1 mmol), 1H-imidazole
(1.2 mmol), K2CO3 (1.2 mmol), and Cu/Al-HTB (100 mg, 2.5 mol%) in DMF (2
mL) was stirred in a round-bottomed flask at 100 °C. When the reaction
was complete (TLC), the catalyst was filtered washed several times with
DMF, H2O and acetone and reused for the next reaction. DMF was removed
from the reaction filtrate under reduced pressure and crude material was
purified by chromatography (silica gel, 60-120 mesh, hexane-EtOAc) to
afford 2e.11 Product 2i. Yield 99%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM green chemistry-catalyst
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Cu-Al hydrotalcite: an efficient and reusable ligand-free catalyst for
the coupling of aryl chlorides with aliphatic, aromatic, and
N(H)-heterocyclic amines
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Sreedhar, B.; Arundhathi, R.; Reddy, P. Linga; Reddy, M. Amarnath;
Kantam, M. Lakshmi
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2009), (15), 2517-2522

$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure. An oven-dried 25 mL
round-bottomed flask with a magnetic stirring bar was charged with CuI
nanoparticles (1.25 mol %), K2CO3 (0.1662 g, 1.2 mmol),
nitrogencontaining heterocycle (1.2 mmol)/phenol (1.2 mmol), aryl
chloride (1.0 mmol), and DMF (1 mL) under air. The reaction mixture was
stirred for 30 min at room temperature and then transferred to a
preheated oil bath at 110 °C. At the end of the reaction, as judged by
TLC, the reaction mixture was then cooled to room temperature, diluted
with 2-3 mL of EtOAc, and centrifuged to remove the catalyst, and the
catalyst was further washed with 5-10 mL of EtOAc to make it free from
organic matter. The combined organic extracts were then concentrated
under reduced pressure, and the resulting residue was purified by column
chromatography on silica gel (60-120) using hexane/ethyl acetate (80:20)
eluent to provide the desired N-arylated/ O-arylated product. The
catalyst was oven-dried at 65 °C for 2 h and reused.
2-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)benzaldehyde (Table 2, Entry 9): Yield 99 %. 1H NMR
(400 MHz, CDCl3, ppm): δ 7.05-7.11 (m, 1H), 7.25-7.35 (m, 2H), 7.41-7.51
(m, 1H), 7.60- 7.65 (m, 1H), 7.76-7.77 (m, 2H), 10.51 (s, 1H); 13C NMR
(100 MHz, CDCl3, ppm): δ 111.7, 115.2, 125.5, 127.5, 128.5, 135.7, 137.6,
141.6, 146.4, 177.6. GC-MS: m/z = 172 (M+).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM CuI nanoparticles used as cat..
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(20), 7951-7954

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Synthesis of
1-Aryl-1H-imidazoles 1b-f. To a flame-dried reaction vessel were added
imidazole (13) (2.04 g, 30.0 mmol), 1,10-phenanthroline (3.60 g, 20.0
mmol), trans,trans-dibenzylidene acetone (dba) (0.23 g, 1.0 mmol), Cs2CO3
(7.17 g, 22.0 mmol), copper(I) trifluomethanesulfonate toluene complex
(0.52 g, 1.0 mmol), and an aryl iodide 2 (20.0 mmol), if a solid. The
reaction vessel was fitted with a silicon septum, evacuated, and
back-filled with argon, and this sequence was repeated twice. Xylenes (4
mL) and an aryl iodide 2 (20.0 mmol), if a liquid, were then added
successively under a stream of argon by syringe at room temperature. The
resulting mixture was stirred under argon at 110 °C until GLC analysis
showed that the reaction was complete (24-91 h). The resultant
heterogeneous mixture was allowed to cool to room temperature, diluted
with EtOAc, filtered through a plug of silica gel, and eluted with
additional EtOAc. The filtrate was concentrated under reduced pressure,
and the residue was purified by MPLC on silica gel to provide the desired
product. This procedure allowed us to prepare compounds 1b,d-f in 96-99%
yield. 1-(1-Naphthyl)-1H-imidazole (1d). The crude reaction product
obtained from the copper(I)-catalyzed reaction of 13 with 2h was purified
by MPLC on silica gel with a mixture of CH2Cl2 and methanol (98 : 2) as
eluent to give 1d (3.84 g, 99 %) as a yellow solid: mp 58–59°C; 1H NMR
(200 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.97–7.92 (m, 2H), 7.77 (br s, 1H), 7.59–7.42 (m, 5H),
7.31–7.26 (m, 2H); 13C NMR (50.3 MHz, CDCl3) δ 138.3, 134.0, 129.3 (2C),
129.1 (2C), 128.2, 127.5, 126.8, 125.0, 123.5, 122.2, 121.5; ); IR (KBr)
ν max 3103, 1593, 1499, 1486, 1247, 1033, 774 cm-1; EI-MS: m/z (%) 195
(14), 194 (100), 193 (32), 166 (50), 154 (19), 139 (18), 127 (21); Anal.
Calcd. for C13H10N2: C, 80.39; H, 5.19. Found: C, 80.25; H, 5.07. The
spectral properties of this compound were in agreement with those
previously reported.2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

palladium-catalyzed direct arylation of 1-aryl-1H-imidazoles

$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES

$DATUM 99
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 584-08-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7681-65-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM [0105] A mixture o f 2-bromo-9-phenyl-9H-carbazole (11.6 g, 36.0 rnmol),
imidazole (3.68 g, 54.0 rnmol), CuI (1.371 g, 7.20 rnmol) and K2CO3 (7.46
g, 54.0 rnmol) in DMF (150 ml) was heated under nitrogen at 140° C.
overnight. After cooling to room temperature, the mixture was quenched
with water and extracted with DCM. The combined extracts were filtered
through a short plug of Celite®. The filtrate was washed with water and
dried over Na2SO4. Upon evaporation of the solvent, the residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel with DCM/MeOH (10/0 to
95/5, v/v) as eluent. 2-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)-9-phenyl-H-carbazole (11.1 g,
99%) as a liquid.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Heteroleptic iridium complexes containing carbazole-imidazole-carbene
ligands and application of the same in light-emitting devices
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Zeng, Lichang; Barron, Edward; Ma, Bin; Xia, Chuanjun
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM United States, US20130306940 A1 2013-11-21

$DATUM 584-08-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7681-65-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure. An oven-dried 25 mL
round-bottomed flask with a magnetic stirring bar was charged with CuI
nanoparticles (1.25 mol %), K2CO3 (0.1662 g, 1.2 mmol),
nitrogencontaining heterocycle (1.2 mmol)/phenol (1.2 mmol), aryl
chloride (1.0 mmol), and DMF (1 mL) under air. The reaction mixture was
stirred for 30 min at room temperature and then transferred to a
preheated oil bath at 110 °C. At the end of the reaction, as judged by
TLC, the reaction mixture was then cooled to room temperature, diluted
with 2-3 mL of EtOAc, and centrifuged to remove the catalyst, and the
catalyst was further washed with 5-10 mL of EtOAc to make it free from
organic matter. The combined organic extracts were then concentrated
under reduced pressure, and the resulting residue was purified by column
chromatography on silica gel (60-120) using hexane/ethyl acetate (80:20)
eluent to provide the desired N-arylated/ O-arylated product. The
catalyst was oven-dried at 65 °C for 2 h and reused.
1-(4-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)phenyl)ethanone (Table 2, Entry 13): White solid,
99 %. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3, ppm): δ 2.61 (s, 3H), 7.42-7.58 (m, 3H),
7.80 (br s, 1H), 8.05- 8.15 (m, 3H); 13C NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3+DMSO, ppm): δ
26.7, 117.9, 120.7, 130.5, 131.2, 135.4, 135.7, 140.7, 196.6. EI-MS: m/z
= 186 (M+).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM CuI nanoparticles used as cat..
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM CuI Nanoparticles for C-N and C-O Cross Coupling of Heterocyclic Amines
and Phenols with Chlorobenzenes
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Sreedhar, B.; Arundhathi, R.; Reddy, P. Linga; Kantam, M. Lakshmi
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(20), 7951-7954

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-05-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Polymer-Bound Imidazole 2 To a slurry of resin 1 (2% crosslinking, 1.00
g, 1 mmol) in MeCN (6.5 mL) were added imidazole (0.68 g, 10 mmol) and
NaI (0.01 g, 0.07 mmol) and the mixture was refluxed with stirring for 48
h. The resin was filtered off and washed successively with MeCN (5 5 mL),
10% aq K2CO3 /MeOH (1:1), H2O/MeOH (1:1), MeOH and Et2O (5 10 mL each).
The solid was dried under vacuum overnight to yield resin 2. Yield (1.03
g, 99%, 0.96 mmol/g). Anal. found: Cl 0.03, N 2.70.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM resin supported reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

efficient and recyclable oxidant
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

Alvarez-Builla, Julio
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2001), (3), 382-388

$DATUM 13682-61-6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Preparation of complexes All the complexes of
the type AuCl3(nu) (nu = oxazole, 2,4,5-trimethyloxazole, thiazole,
5-methylthiazole, 4,5-dimethylthiazole, 2,4-dimethylthiazole,
2,4,5-trimethylthiazole, imidazole, and 2-methylimidazole) were prepared
as follows. The ligand nu (1 mmol), dissolved in a small volume of water
(2-3 ml), was added, drop by drop, to an aqueous solution (20 ml) of
KAuCl4. 2H2O (0.415 g, 1 mmol). The bright yellow precipitate that formed
immediately was filtered off, washed three times with water (10 ml) and
dried in vacuo. Yield quantitative (>95%). Found C: 9.8%, H: 1.2%; N:
7.75%; Cl: 28.7%; Calcd: C: 9.7%, H: 1.1%; N: 7.5; Cl: 28.6%; 1H-n.m.r.a
8.53 (s, slightly br, 1H, H2); 7.54, 7.42 (2s, slightly br, 2H, H4-H5).

(20): Aldehyde syn-2a (50 mg, 0.157 mmol), 2-aminoimidazole sulphate (42
mg, 0.320 mmol) and NaOAc (29 mg, 0.350 mmol) were stirred under reflux

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 1-[2,2-[[Bis-(2,4-dichlorophenyl)]methoxy]ethyl]-1H-imidazole (56). A
solution of 119 and sodium iodide (0.47 g, 0.0031 mol) in DMF (10 mL) was
stirred for 30 min at 100 °C. Imidazole (0.53 g, 0.0078 mol) was added to
the mixture, and the mixture was stirred for 4 h at 100 °C. After the
mixture was cooled, water was added and the mixture was extracted with
ethyl acetate. The organic layer was washed with brine, dried, and
evaporated to give 56 (98%) as a red oil.
1-[2,2-[[Bis-(2,4-dichlorophenyl)]methoxy]ethyl]-1H-imidazole (56). ,
yield 98% 1H NMR (CDCl3): δ 3.76-3.79 (t, J = 5.14 Hz, 2H), 4.14-4.17 (t,
J = 4.97 Hz, 2H), 5.99 (s, 1H), 6.90 (s, 1H), 6.95 (s, 1H), 6.97 (s, 1H),
7.06 (s, 1H), 7.17 (d, J = 2.09 Hz, 1H), 7.19 (d, J = 2.05 Hz, 1H), 7.38
(d, J = 2.13 Hz, 2H), 7.52 ppm (s, 1H). Anal. (C18H14Cl4 N2 O (416.14)).
C, H, Cl, N.

$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Syntheses. 2-Imidazolylethanol, [HOCH2CH2Im (Im = imidazolyl)] (1). Into
a 500 mL two-necked round-bottomed flask fitted with a sidearm and a
two-way stopcock and maintained under N2-atmosphere was placed a magnetic
stirbar and sodium hydride (3.38, 11.3 mmol) in 150 mL of dry
dimethylformamide (DMF). Approximately 7.67 g (11.3 mmol) of imidazole in
25 mL of DMF was added slowly to the stirring solution. The mixture was
warmed to 90 °C for 1 h and then cooled. Chloroethanol (9.10 mL, 11.3
mmol) in 25 mL of DMF was added slowly to the reaction mixture, which was
heated at 90 °C for 24 h. After cooling to 25 °C, the mixture was
filtered, and the filtrate was evaporated under reduced pressure to yield
crude 1. NMR (1H and 13C) evidence showed that the product was >98% 1. It
was not purified further. It solidified (brown wax) on long standing at
room temperature. Analytical data for 1: IR: 3241 cm-1 ν(OH). NMR: 1H, δ
3.79 (t, 2H, NCH 2), 3.98 (t, 2H, CH 2O), 6.54 (br, 1H, OH), 6.84 (s, 1H,
Im-H), 6.90 (s, 1H, Im-H), 7.34 (s, 1H, Im-H); 13C, δ 50.0, 61.2, 119.5,
128.3, 137.3 ppm. GC-MS (EI) (m/z, species, intensity (%)): 112, M+, 65.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Triazine-Based Polyfluorinated Triquaternary Liquid Salts: Synthesis,
Characterization, and Application as Solvents in Rhodium(I)-Catalyzed
Hydroformylation of 1-Octene
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Omotowa, Bamidele A.; Shreeve, Jean'ne M.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organometallics (2004), 23(4), 783-791

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Experimental Procedure for the
Conjugate Addition of Imidazole to α ,β -Unsaturated Compounds: In a
typical procedure, α ,β-unsaturated compound (1.0 mmol), imidazole (1.0
mmol) and catalyst (3.6 mol%) were taken in toluene (5 mL) and stirred at
reflux temperature for 12 h. The resulting reaction mixture was filtered
and washed with EtOAc (3 × 5 mL) and concentrated under reduced pressure.
The crude product was purified by column chromatography to afford the
pure product. All the products gave satisfactory NMR data and mass
spectral data.12a,29 Table 2 Entry 4, yield 98%.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure. A flame-dried Schlenk test
tube with a magnetic stirring bar was charged with CuI (38.4 mg, 0.2
mmol), K3PO4 (0.422 g, 2.0 mmol), nitrogen-containing heterocycle (1.4
mmol), aryl halide (1.0 mmol), and DMF (1 mL) under N2 atmosphere. A
rubber septum was replaced with a glass stopper, and the system was then
evacuated twice and back filled with N2. After being stirred at 35-40 °C
for 40 h, the reaction mixture was diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate,
filtered through a plug of silica gel, and washed with 10-20 mL of ethyl
acetate. The filtrate was concentrated and the resulting residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel to provide the desired
product. 4-(1H-Imidazol-1-yl)benzaldehyde (3l)3 Following the general
procedure, the crude product was purified over a silica gel column using
ethyl acetate/petroleum ether (1/1) to give a white solid (98% yield). 1H
NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 7.35 (bs, 2H), 7.60 (d, J = 8.4 Hz, 2H), 8.03 (m,
3H), 10.07 (s, 1H) ppm. GC-MS (EI, m/z): 172 [M+].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Highly Functional Group Tolerance in Copper-Catalyzed N-Arylation of
Nitrogen-Containing Heterocycles under Mild Conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Zhu, Liangbo; Li, Gaocan; Luo, Liang; Guo, Peng; Lan, Jingbo; You,
Jingsong
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(5), 2200-2202

$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Intermediate 6 1-(5-Chloropentanoyl)-1H-imidazole A 50 mL round bottom
flask was charged with imidazole (420 mg, 6.17 mmol) and was evacuated
and back-filled with N2. Anhydrous THF (3.0 mL) was added, and the
resulting solution was treated with 5-chlorovaleroyl chloride (390
&#x03BC;L, 3.02 mmol). After stirring at room temperature overnight, the
slurry was diluted with a few mL Of CH2Cl2 and was filtered through a pad
of MgSO4. The filtrate was concentrated to a colorless oil that
solidified on standing (552 mg, 98%). 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) &#x03B4;
1.87 -1.99 (m, 4 H) 2.91 (t, J=7.07 Hz, 2 H) 3.58 (t, J=6.19 Hz, 2 H)
7.08 (s, 1 H) 7.46 (s, 1 H) 8.16 (s, 1 H).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of heterocyclic sulfonamide compounds as Edg-1 antagonists
for treatment of cancer
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Grewal, Gurmit; Oza, Vibbha
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2008059238 A1 2008-05-22

$DATUM 7778-53-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: GENERAL SYNTHETIC PROCEDURE N-Heterocycles (1
mmol) and α ,β -unsaturated carbonyl compounds (1.2 mmol) were added to a
10-mL flask containing anhydrous K3PO4 (0.25 mmol), and the mixture was
stirred at room temperature for a period of time. The reaction mixture
was filtered, and the filtrate was evaporated under reduced pressure. The
residue was purified by flash-column chromatography (silica gel,
petroleum ether-ethyl acetate) to obtain the corresponding Michael
adducts. All compounds can be stored at rt for several months without
decomposition. 3-Imidazole-1-yl-propionic Acid t-Butyl Ester (3c) Yellow
oil. Yield 98%. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 1.423 (s, 9H), 2.680 (t, 2H,
J=6.8 Hz), 4.220 (t, 2H, J=6.8 Hz), 6.930 (t, 1H, J=1.2 Hz), 7.041 (t,
1H, J=1.1 Hz), 7.499 (s, 1H). ESI-MS: m/z=197 (M+1).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM regioselective, Michael addition
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Mild and efficient procedure for Michael addition of N-heterocycles to
α,β-unsaturated compounds using anhydrous K3PO4 as catalyst

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Example 13.
2-[(E)-2-{2-Fluoro-4-trifluoromethyl-phenyl)-vinyl]-4-[4-{4-imidazol-1-ylmethyl-oxazol-2-yl)-phenoxymethyl]-oxazole.
A suspension of 2.23 g (10 mmol)
4-chloromethyl-2-(4-methoxy-phenyl)-oxazole, 1.02 g (15 mmol) imidazole,
0.17 g (1 mmol) potassium iodide and 0.60 g (15 mmol) sodium hydroxide in
25 ml 2-methyl-2-butanol was stirred at 120°C for 5 h. After evaporation,
the residue was quenched with water and extracted with ethyl acetate. The
extract was dried and concentrated to yield 2.51 g (98%)
1-[2-{4-methoxy-phenyl)-oxazol-4-ylmethyl]-imidazole as beige crystals.
MS: M = 256.2(API+). 1H-NMR(400MHz, D6-DMSO): δ= 3.82(s, 3H, OCH3),
5.16(8, 2H, CH2), 6.91(s, 1H, imidazole), 7.08(d, 2H, Ar-H), 7.21(s, 1H,
imidazole), 7.74(s, 1H, imidazole), 7.89(d, 2H, Ar-H), 8.09(s, 1H,
oxazole).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of (E)-2-phenylethenyl-4-(arylalkoxy)-oxazoles or -thiazoles
as HER-2 tyrosine kinases inhibitors and their use in the treatment of
cancer
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

Matthias; Voss, Edgar
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION

$DATUM 67-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Example 27. PREPARATION OF 5-BROMO-2-(1H-IMIDAZOL-1-YL)BENZONITRILE.
K2CO3 (3.337 g, 24.4 mmol) was added to a stirred solution of
5-bromo-2-fiuorobenzonitrile (2.5 g, 12.2 mmol) in DMSO (50 mL), followed
by the addition of 1H-imidazole (996 rng, 14.64 mmol). The reaction
mixture was heated to 90°C. overnight, and diluted with water. The
reaction mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate. The organic layer was
washed with water and brine, dried with sodium sulfate, filtered, and
concentrated under reduced pressure to yield the imidazolylbenzonitrile
as an off-white solid (2.97 g, 98% yield). 1H NMR (CDCl3) δ 7.97 (m, 2H),
7.90 (m, 1H), 7.41 (d, J=8 Hz, 1H), 7.37 (s, 1H), 7.32 (s, 1H).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM DMF solvent may also be used, alternative reaction conditions shown
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Methods of treatment of amyloidosis using bi-aryl aspartyl protease
inhibitors
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM John, Varghese; Hom, Roy; Sealy, Jennifer; Tucker, John
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM United States, US20060014737 A1 2006-01-19

$DATUM EXAMPLE 15: PREPARATION OF 5-BROMO-2-(1H-IMIDAZOL-1-YL)BENZONITRILE K2CO3
(3.337 g, 24.4 mmol) was added to a stirred solution of
5-Bromo-2-fluorobenzonitrile (2.5 g, 12.2 mmol) in DMSO (50 mL), followed
by the addition of 1H-imidazole (996 mg, 14.64 mmol). The reaction
mixture was heated to 90 °C overnight, and diluted with water. The
reaction mixture was extracted with EtOAC (x2). The organic layer was
washed with water (x1 ) and brine (x1), dried (sodium sulfate), filtered,
and concentrated under reduced pressure to yield 2.97 g of the
imidazolylbenzonitrile as an off-white solid (98% yield). 1H NMR (CDCl3)
δ 7.97 (m, 2 H), 7.90 (m, 1 H), 7.41 (d, J = 8 Hz, 1 H), 7.37 (s, 1 H),
7.32 (s, 1 H).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM regioselective, DMF also used as solvent

$DATUM H. 5-bromo-2-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)benzonitrile To a stirred solution
5-Bromo-2-fluorobenzonitrile (2.5 g, 12.2 mmol) in DMSO (50 mL) was added
K2CO3 (3.337 g, 24.4 mmol), and then 1H-imidazole (996 mg, 14.64 mmol).
The reaction mixture was heated to 90°C overnight, and diluted with
water. The reaction mixture was extracted with EtOAC (x2) . The organic
layer was washed with washed with water (x1) and brine (x1), dried with
sodium sulfate, filtered, and concentrated under reduced pressure to
afford the imidazolylbenzonitrile. Off-white solid, yield 2.97 g, 98%. 1H
NMR (CDCl3) δ 7.97 (m, 2 H), 7.90 (m, 1 H), 7.41 (d, J = 8 Hz, 1 H), 7.37
(s, 1 H), 7.32 (s, 1 H) .

$DATUM 1-(1R,2S,5R)-(−)-Menthoxymethylimidazole (1). Chloromethyl
(1R,2S,5R)-(−)-menthyl ether (10.225 g, 0.05 mol) was slowly added to a
stirred anhydrous solution of triethylamine (5.05 g, 0.05 mol) in toluene
(50 mL), and stirring was continued at 80 °C for 20 min. Imidazole (3.4
g, 0.05 mol) was then added, and the mixture was refluxed next 30 min.
After being cooled to room temperature, the triethylamine hydrochloride
produced was filtered off. The organic phase was washed with saturated
sodium chloride solution, dried over (Na2SO4), and concentrated by
rotoevaporation. The product was purified by vacuum distillation. After
solidification of the pure, colorless liquids, the white solid was
crystallized. The crystalline final product was further dried in vacuum
(0.3 mmHg). Analytically pure 1 (yield: 98%, 0.049 mol, 11.58 g). 1H NMR
(300 MHz, CDCl3): δ 0.45 (d, J = 6.9 Hz, 3H, H9 or H10), 0.80−0.95 (m,
9H, Ha-4, H7, H9 or H10, Ha-6 and Ha-3), 1.15−1.40 (m, 2H, H2 and H5),
1.58− 1.65 (m, 2H, Hb-3 and Hb-4), 1.87−1.95 (m, 1H, Hb-6), 2.01 (sept d,
J = 7.1 Hz and J = 2.6, 1H, H8), 3.12 (td, J = 10.6 Hz and J = 4.3 Hz,
1H, H1), 5.32 (m, 2H, H11), 7.04−7.05 (m, 1H, H13), 7.08 (m, 1H, H12),
7.59 (m, J = 1.1 Hz, 1H, H14). 13C NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3): δ 15.0 (C9 or
C10), 20.5 (C7), 21.7 (C9 or C10), 22.5 (C3), 24.8 (C8), 30.8 (C5), 33.7
(C4), 39.5 (C6), 47.4 (C2), 73.2 (C1), 76.5 (C11), 118.5 (C13), 129.2
(C12), 136.8 (C14). HRMS (ESI +) m/z calcd for [C14H24N2O]+ 237.1967,
found 237.1978. Anal. Calcd for C14H24N2O: C, 71.12; H, 10.25; N, 11.85.
Found: C, 70.96; H, 10.51; N, 11.73. Crystal data: C14H24N2O, M r =
236,35, monoclinic, space group P21, a = 6.2999(11) Å, b = 7.7215912) Å,
c = 14.823(2) Å, β = 95.614(13)°, V = 717.6(2) Å3, Z = 2, d x = 1.09
g·cm-3, F(000) = 260, μ(Mo Kα) = 0.069 mm−1. 4678 reflections collected
up to 2Θ = 52°, 2219 symmetry-independent (R int = 0.029), 2020 with I >
2σ(I). Final R(F) = 4.74% (I > 2σ(I)), 5.21% (all reflections), wR(F 2) =
0.119 (I > 2σ(I)), 0.123 (all reflections), S = 1.10. In the final
residual map, Δρ max/Δρ min = 0.27/−0.28 e·Å−3.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

product depends on reactant ratio and reaction conditions

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 1-Cyclohexanoylimidazole: General procedure for the preparation of
acyl-imidazoles and -pyrazoles: In a typical experiment imidazole (20
mmol) was dissolved in distilled CH2Cl2 (20 mL) containing TEA (20 mmol)
and cooled to 0 degC under a steady flow of argon. The requisite acid
chloride (20 mmol) dissolved in 10 mL of CH2Cl2 (distilled) was delivered
dropwise over several minutes to the stirring solution imidazole solution
at 0 degC. The mixture was allowed to warm to 25 degC and stirred at this
temperature for 2 hr to ensure completion. The reaction mixture was then
diluted with 100 mL of diethyl ether, filtered and evaporated under
reduced pressure. Purification through silica gel with hexanes:ethyl
acetate (3:1) furnished 100 % yields. According to the general procedure,
the product was obtained. 3.5 g (98 %); pale yellow solid; mp 74-75 degC.

$DATUM Example 3: Preparation of sorafenib intermediate imidazole-1-carboxylic
acid (4-chloro-3-trifluoromethyl-phenyl)-amide of formula 4b.
4-Chloro-3-(trifluoromethyl)phenyl isocyanate (15.0 g) was added to a
solution of imidazole (4.6 g) in CHCl3 (150 g) at room temperature. The
initial solution was stirred at room temperature for 1h, obtaining a
suspension which was cooled to 0 °C and kept under stirring for 1 h. The
solid was filtered off, washed with CHCl3 and dried at 40 °C under
reduced pressure for 16 h, to yield 19.2 g (98%) of intermediate 4b.
1H-NMR (300 MHz) spectrum in CDCl3: chemical shifts at about 7.913 (1 H,
d,J=2.7), 7.836 (1 H, dd,J=8.7, 2.7 Hz), 7.480 (1 H, d,J=8.7 Hz), 8.418
(1 H, dd,J=1.4, 0.9 Hz), 7.725 (1 H, dd,J=1.6, 1.4 Hz), 7.097 (1 H,
dd,J=1.6, 0.9 Hz). MS-ESI spectrum:[M+H]+ m/z 290/292.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Process for preparation of sorafenib and intermediates thereof

$DATUM [3-tert-Butyl-5-(imidazolylmethyl)phenyl]methanol 17b. A stirred
suspension of 1H-imidazole (0.2 g, 2.74 mmol) and finely powered KOH 85%
(0.24 g, 3.56 mmol) in dry acetonitrile (60 mL) was maintained at room
temperature for 2 h. To the yellow suspension, a solution of compound 15
(2.74 mmol) in dry acetonitrile (25 mL) was added dropwise, and the
reaction mixture was refluxed for 24 h. The solvent was evaporated to
dryness, and the solid residue was dissolved in water (200 mL) and
extracted with CH2Cl2 (3 × 100 mL). The organic layer was dried
(anhydrous Na2SO4) and the solvent was eliminated in rotary evaporator.
Compound 17b as a dark yellow oil. molecular formula: C15H20N2O·0.75 H2O.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure To a solution of diazole (3
mmol) and aryl iodides (1 mmol) in xylene (3 mL) under argon atmosphere
were added CuI (38 mg, 20 mol%) and 1,10-phenanthroline (40 mg, 20 mol%)
followed by KF/Al2O320 (5 equiv, 780 mg) and stirred at 130-140 °C for
specified times (Table 1). The progress of the reaction was monitored by
TLC. The reaction mixture allowed to cool to r.t. and was then
partitioned between CH2Cl2 (30 mL) and sat. aq NH4Cl (3 × 10 mL). The
organic phase was washed with H2O (3 × 10 mL), dried (Na2SO4), filtered
and concentrated. The crude product was purified by column chromatography
on silica gel using hexane-EtOAc as eluent (9:1). Table 1, entry 8, yield
98%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Highly efficient copper-catalyzed formation of N-aryl diazoles using
KF/Al2O3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Hosseinzadeh, Rahman; Tajbakhsh, Mahmood; Alikarami, Mohammad
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2006), (13), 2124-2126

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for N-Arylation of Imidazole
with Aryl Bromides. A Schlenk tube equipped with a Teflon stopcock are
charged with a magnetic stir bar, K2CO3 (572 mg, 2.1 mmol), CuI (0.38 mg,
0.20 mmol, 20 mol %), and per-6-amino- β -cyclodextrin (100 mg, 0.08
mmol, 8 mol %). DMSO (1 mL) was added at room temperature. Then a
solution of bromobenzene (188 mg, 1.2 mmol) and imidazole (68 mg, 1.0
mmol) in DMSO (1 mL) was added. The tube was sealed and the mixture was
allowed to stir for 24 h at 110°C. Water (5 mL) was added to the reaction
mixture after completion of the reaction. Then it was extracted with
ethyl acetate (3 × 20 mL) and the combined organic layers were dried with
anhydrous Na2SO4 and concentrated by vacuum. The residue was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel, using hexane/ethyl acetate (1:3) as
eluant, to give an oil of 1-phenylimidazole 4a (164 mg, 98%)
5-(1H-Imidazol-1-yl)pyrimidine (4r), yield 98% 1H NMR (300 MHz): 9.25 (s,
1H), 8.90 (s, 2H), 7.45-7.84 (m, 2H), 7.33 (s, 1H) 13C NMR (75 MHz):
157.4, 149.4, 135.1, 131.8, 128.3, 117.5 GC-MS: m/z 146.0 (M+)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM sealed tube used, Ullmann reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Per-6-amino-β-cyclodextrin as an Efficient Supramolecular Ligand and Host
for Cu(I)-Catalyzed N-Arylation of Imidazole with Aryl Bromides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Suresh, Palaniswamy; Pitchumani, Kasi
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2008), 73(22), 9121-9124
